snippet.title: Howl: Original Draft Facsimile, Transcript, and Variant ...
snippet.description: This annotated version of Ginsberg's classic is the poet's own re-creation of the revolutionary work's composition process—as well as a treasure trove of anecdotes, an intimate look at the poet's writing techniques, and a veritable social ...

snippet.title: American Scream: Allen Ginsberg's Howl and the Making of ...
snippet.description: "Jonah Raskin's American Scream adds to the ever-growing fact and fiction of the Allen Ginsberg persona. All Ginsberg addicts will have to have this book for adulation and reassessment.

snippet.title: Howl: A Graphic Novel
snippet.description: First published in 1956, Allen Ginsberg's Howl is a prophetic masterpiece—an epic raging against dehumanizing society that overcame censorship trials and obscenity charges to become one of the most widely read poems of the century.

snippet.title: Howl and Other Poems: Pocket Poets Number 4
snippet.description: Ginsberg's love for a man with whom he shared some of life's worst experiences is celebrated in poems which were once the subject of a prolonged court trial

snippet.title: Howl on Trial: The Battle for Free Expression
snippet.description: Letters, press reports, excerpts from the trial transcript and decision, and other texts document the 1957 obscenity trial of San Francisco beat poet Allen Ginsburg and looks at censorship in the United States and the battle against it.

snippet.title: On the Poetry of Allen Ginsberg
snippet.description: Gathers critical essays about Ginsberg's early works, major poems, essential themes, and public image
